aima.core.probability.temporal
Interface BackwardStepInference

All Known Subinterfaces:
ForwardBackwardInference
All Known Implementing Classes:
ForwardBackward, HMMForwardBackward, HMMForwardBackwardConstantSpace
public interface BackwardStepInference

The BACKWARD operator

 bk+1:t = P(ek+1:t | Xk)
is defined by Equation (15.9).
 P(ek+1:t | Xk) 
 = ∑xk+1P(ek+1:t | Xk, xk+1)P(xk+1 | Xk) (conditioning on Xk+1)
 = ∑xk+1P(ek+1:t | xk+1)P(xk+1 | Xk) (by conditional independence)
 = ∑xk+1P(ek+1, ek+2:t | xk+1)P(xk+1 | Xk)
 = ∑xk+1P(ek+1 | xk+1)P(ek+2:t | xk+1)P(xk+1 | Xk)

Author:
Ciaran O'Reilly

Method Summary
 CategoricalDistribution backward(CategoricalDistribution b_kp2t, java.util.List<AssignmentProposition> e_kp1t)
          The BACKWARD operator
 

Method Detail

backward

CategoricalDistribution backward(CategoricalDistribution b_kp2t,
                                 java.util.List<AssignmentProposition> e_kp1t)
The BACKWARD operator
 bk+1:t = P(ek+1:t | Xk)
is defined by Equation (15.9).
 P(ek+1:t | Xk) 
 = ∑xk+1P(ek+1:t | Xk, xk+1)P(xk+1 | Xk) (conditioning on Xk+1)
 = ∑xk+1P(ek+1:t | xk+1)P(xk+1 | Xk) (by conditional independence)
 = ∑xk+1P(ek+1, ek+2:t | xk+1)P(xk+1 | Xk)
 = ∑xk+1P(ek+1 | xk+1)P(ek+2:t | xk+1)P(xk+1 | Xk)

Parameters:
b_kp2t - bk+2:t
e_kp1t - ek+1:t
Returns:
bk+1:t
